tool.name: SAGA.imagery_segmentation.4
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayFEATURES True output_data_POLYGONS $output_data_POLYGONS output_data_SUPERPIXELS $output_data_SUPERPIXELS name SAGA.imagery_segmentation.4 FEATURES $FEATURES NORMALIZE $NORMALIZE MAX_ITERATIONS $MAX_ITERATIONS REGULARIZATION $REGULARIZATION SIZE $SIZE SIZE_MIN $SIZE_MIN SUPERPIXELS_DO $SUPERPIXELS_DO POSTPROCESSING $POSTPROCESSING NCLUSTER $NCLUSTER SPLIT_CLUSTERS $SPLIT_CLUSTERS prefer $prefer response $response outputType_POLYGONS $OutputSection_POLYGONS.outputType_POLYGONS transmissionMode_POLYGONS $OutputSection_POLYGONS.transmissionMode_POLYGONS outputType_SUPERPIXELS $OutputSection_SUPERPIXELS.outputType_SUPERPIXELS transmissionMode_SUPERPIXELS $OutputSection_SUPERPIXELS.transmissionMode_SUPERPIXELS

param.name: FEATURES
param.label: Features
param.help: Features The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, png, x-ogc-envi, tiff

param.name: SIZE
param.label: Region Size
param.help: Starting 'cell size' of the superpixels given as number of cells.

param.name: SIZE_MIN
param.label: Minimum Region Size
param.help: In postprocessing join segments, which cover less cells than specified here, to a larger neighbour segment.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_POLYGONS
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

section.name: OutputSection_SUPERPIXELS
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

tool.help: The Superpixel Segmentation tool implements the 'Simple Linear Iterative Clustering' (SLIC) algorithm, an image segmentation method described in Achanta et al. (2010). <br/><br/>SLIC is a simple and efficient method to decompose an image in visually homogeneous regions. It is based on a spatially localized version of k-means clustering. Similar to mean shift or quick shift, each pixel is associated to a feature vector. <br/><br/>This tool is follows the SLIC implementation created by Vedaldi and Fulkerson as part of the VLFeat library.
